articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: Simona Aebersold (SUI) and Kasper Fosser (NOR) won today’s Orienteering World Cup sprint in Genoa, Italy by large margins. With an arena beautifully located on the waterfront in Genoa’s western end and a both varied and challenging sprint course, Round 2 of the World Cup got off to a great start. Both the women’s and […]
articles.title: World Cup: Aebersold and Fosser take huge margin wins in Genoa

articles.author: Clive
articles.description: The Long Distance medals were won by two favourites: Nikoline Splittorff, Denmark, winner of the Sprint yesterday, and Vojtech Ludvik, Czechia, leader of the IOF World Rankings. Both riders were in front at the mid-race time-check and made good route choices throughout on a day with good riding conditions. Splittorff, women’s World Ranking leader, is […]
articles.title: CX80 EMTBOC Long Distance: second gold for Denmark, first for Czechia

articles.author: Clive
articles.description: Nikoline Splittorff, Denmark and Samuel Pokala, Finland won today’s Sprint races in the CX80 European MTBO Championships in northern Poland, both by clear margins. Medals went to 5 nations on a warm sunny day in high-speed terrain. There were many changes in position as the races progressed, with opportunity in places for short-cuts off the […]
articles.title: First CX80 EMTBOC golds to Denmark and Finland

articles.author: Sondre Sande Gullord
articles.description: Eline Gemperle and Jonathan Ståhl are appointed by the newly elected IOF Athlete Representatives to represent the athletes at IOF Council in the upcoming General Assembly period, which starts after the IOF General Assembly 2024. The four elected Athlete Advisory Groups has appointed representatives to the new Athletes’ Commission  –  two members from each discipline: […]
articles.title: New athlete representatives at IOF Council

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: We have only just said goodbye to Olten, Switzerland but it’s already time to continue the Orienteering World Cup in Genoa, Italy this weekend. Round 2 consists of a sprint on Saturday and a sprint relay on Sunday at the edge of the Mediterranean. And it is literally on the edge of the Mediterranean, since […]
articles.title: How to follow Orienteering World Cup Round 2 in Italy

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: Finland’s Tuomas Heikkilä leads the men’s World Cup, while Switzerland’s Natalia Gemperle and Simona Aebersold share first place in the women’s after this weekend’s Round 1 in Olten, Switzerland. Heikkilä had an impressive weekend with a third place in Saturday’s Knock-Out Sprint, which he followed up with a second place in the sprint the following […]
articles.title: Heikkilä and Swiss duo lead World Cup standings before Genoa

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: Poland is the host for this year’s CX80 World Cup first round, the European MTBO Championships, with four days of intense racing scheduled from Thursday to Sunday. 109 athletes from 20 nations will be striving for the medals. Almost all the top names in MTBO are entered, including all the defending European Champions except for […]
articles.title: CX80 EMTBOC: Europe’s MTBO stars gather in Poland

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: The old city center of Olten, Switzerland and the many energetic spectators in the arena created another nice backdrop for Sunday’s individual World Cup sprint Switzerland’s Natalia Gemperle took her first World Cup win in six years – a comfortable one with 12 seconds of margin, whereas Emil Svensk (SWE) only secured his victory by […]
articles.title: World Cup: Gemperle and Svensk win fast sprint in Switzerland

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: Joey Hadorn (SUI) and Tove Alexandersson (SWE) took the first Orienteering World Cup wins of 2024 with their victories in Saturday’s Knock-Out Sprint in Switzerland. Yesterday’s heavy rain was nowhere to be seen in sunny, central Olten, that hosted all of Saturday’s races from the quarter finals before noon and until the finals some hours […]
articles.title: World Cup: Knock-Out wins for Hadorn and Alexandersson

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: The 2024 Orienteering World Cup got underway under very variable weather conditions Friday afternoon in Zofingen, Switzerland, where athletes from 17 out of the competing 32 nations managed to qualify for Saturday’s quarter finals. The sun was shining over the cosy old town centre as the first runners in the men’s three qualification heats made […]
articles.title: World Cup: Athletes from 17 nations make it through Knock-Out Sprint qualifiers

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: This year’s Orienteering World Cup begins in Switzerland this weekend with two sprint races. Simona Aebersold (SUI) claimed her first individual World Champs title on the long distance last year, where she was third in the overall World Cup. Hear her expectations for the 2024 international season in this mini episode of the IOF podcast […]
articles.title: Podcast: Simona Aebersold on the World Cup in Olten and the 2024 international season

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: The greatest international orienteering events will now be accessible to a significantly larger audience. The International Orienteering Federation, IOF, has entered a partnership with the European Broadcasting Union (EBU), the world’s leading alliance for public service media. IOF has a long tradition of collaborating with National Broadcasters in several countries that are also EBU Members. […]
articles.title: IOF enters partnership with EBU to spread Orienteering Worldwide

articles.author: Sondre Sande Gullord
articles.description: The IOF gives financial support (scholarships) to participate in O-Ringen Academy to selected participants from developing orienteering nations. Eight applicants for the O-Ringen Academy 2024 have been granted scholarships from the IOF to participate in the 2024 O-Ringen Academy: Rehab Abdel Raouf (EGY) Ahmet Polat (TUR) Hasan Akdogan (TUR) Safaa Al Abboodi (IRQ) Sayeesha Kirani […]
articles.title: Scholarships for participation in the 2024 O-Ringen Academy

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: The international orienteering season is about to start and you’re invited to follow all the action from the Orienteering World Cup 2024 closely. We start in Switzerland this weekend with Round 1 – a Knock-Out Sprint on Saturday and an individual sprint on Sunday. The city of Olten hosts both races and offers flat and […]
articles.title: How to follow the Orienteering World Cup Round 1 in Switzerland

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: Exactly 230 days after Tove Alexandersson (SWE) and Matthias Kyburz (SUI) crossed the finish line under Vicenza’s October sun to win both the KO Sprint titles at EOC and secure the overall 2023 Orienteering World Cup victories, it’s time to kick off the World Cup again. The 2024 season begins with the youngest discipline, a […]
articles.title: Intense sprints will kick off the new World Cup season

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: Young orienteers will travel to Poland in three years to race for JWOC-medals, while the slightly older ones set course for Japan and the WMOC races the same year. It is clear after IOF Council’s meeting on May 3rd, 2024, where several organisers of future international championships were appointed. It is the fourth time that […]
articles.title: JWOC 2027 appointed to Poland – Japan will host WMOC 2027

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: A number of orienteering events in India over the past nine months have had around 1750 people try their hand at the sport. To date India has had 4 clubs, but four more are on the way, meaning six of the country’s states are on their way to be represented by a club. Several clubs […]
articles.title: Orienteering events in India attract more than 1000 participants

articles.author: Clive
articles.description: The Finnish athlete Lauri Mäkinen won the Final of the TempO competition in a very tight finish where the silver medal was shared and the fourth-placed athlete missed a medal by just 1 second! All that at the end of 9 stations with 5 tasks at each – 45 decision tasks under extreme time pressure […]
articles.title: European TrailO Championships: double TempO medal haul for home nation

articles.author: Clive
articles.description: Norway and Czechia emerged as winners of the two relay classes, O and P; the six sets of medals awarded today go to teams from six different nations. All competitors completed a PreO course of 16 controls followed by two TempO stations, and the third-leg athlete had an additional TempO control at the end, in […]
articles.title: European TrailO Championships: success for Norway and Czechia in Relay

articles.author: Clive
articles.description: Aaron Gaio, Italy and Svein Jakobsen, Norway were the overall winners of the O and P classes respectively after the second day of competition on a cold, sunny and windy day in Turku, Finland. Open class medal winners   Photos: Jari Grönroos Gaio along with Geir Myhr Øien, Norway were the only two competitors to achieve […]
articles.title: European TrailO Championships: PreO gold medals to Italy and Norway

articles.author: Clive
articles.description: 16-year-old Jonatán Furucz, Slovakia leads the O (Open) class field after the first day of the PreO competition, held in cold conditions in Turku, Finland. Svein Jacobsen, Norway heads the P (Physically Challenged) Class. Competitors had a 32-control course in forest rich in contour and rock detail, and many were hard-pressed to complete the course […]
articles.title: European TrailO Championships: young Slovakian leads in PreO

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: The TempO Final at the European TrailO Championships (ETOC) will be televised on Finnish TV and IOF TV as it takes place around the Paavo Nurmi stadium in Turku, Finland on Sunday afternoon, 12th May. This is a first for TrailO, with the whole orienteering world now able to experience the tension and excitement as […]
articles.title: A first! Live TV from Trail Orienteering

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: The forest World Orienteering Championships in 2029 will take place in Örnskjoldsvik, Sweden. That was decided by IOF Council during a meeting on Friday. WOC 2029 will be the fifth World Championships taking place in Sweden – the most recent being WOC 2016 in Strömstad. Sweden also made a bid for the World Orienteering Championships […]
articles.title: WOC 2029 awarded to Sweden

articles.author: Jan Kocbach
articles.description: Sweden and Switzerland dominated the first World Cup weekend of 2024 in Olten, Switzerland – taking two victories each – but with four different winners. Tove Alexandersson (Sweden) and Joey Hadorn (Switzerland) took the victories on the KO-Sprint while Natalia Gemperle (Switzerland) and Emil Svensk (Sweden) took the victories on Sunday’s individual sprint. While the ...
articles.title: World Cup Opening Switzerland 2024: Maps and Results

articles.author: Jan Kocbach
articles.description: The first two Orienteering World Cup rounds of 2024 are about to start in Olten, Switzerland and Genoa, Italy – both organized as pure sprint weekends. It all kicks off in Switzerland from Friday May 24th until Sunday May 26th with a KO-Sprint and an individual Sprint – and continues with another individual Sprint and a Sprint Relay in Italy next weekend. With the ...
articles.title: World Cup Opening Weekends 2024: All You Need To Know

Orienteering Australia has received a Play Well Participation Grant from the ASC, with plans of using the funds for the Learn to Orienteer National Expansion project.
Play Well Participation Grant first appeared on Orienteering Australia.
articles.title: Play Well Participation Grant

articles.author: elizabethl
articles.description:
Five Australian athletes raced in the exciting Knock-Out Sprint format in the World Cup Round 1.
World Cup 1 News Recap first appeared on Orienteering Australia.
articles.title: World Cup 1 News Recap

articles.author: elizabethl
articles.description:
Orienteering Australia has developed a whole of sport participation plan for 2024-2025.
Orienteering Australia launches Orienteering Participation Plan! first appeared on Orienteering Australia.
articles.title: Orienteering Australia launches Orienteering Participation Plan!

articles.author: elizabethl
articles.description:
Read the June edition of The Australian Orienteer, available online now.
The Australian Orienteer: June Edition Now Online first appeared on Orienteering Australia.
articles.title: The Australian Orienteer: June Edition Now Online

articles.author: elizabethl
articles.description:
The Orienteering World Cup Round 1 is being held this weekend (25-26 May) in Olten, Switzerland. Australia will have a team of 5.
Orienteering World Cup Round 1 first appeared on Orienteering Australia.
articles.title: Orienteering World Cup Round 1

articles.author: elizabethl
articles.description:
Congratulations to the winners of the NOL season 2024.
Winners of NOL season 2024 first appeared on Orienteering Australia.

articles.author: elizabethl
articles.description:
Donations made through ASF help support our national teams take part in World Championships.
Support Orienteering Australia’s National Teams first appeared on Orienteering Australia.
articles.title: Support Orienteering Australia’s National Teams

articles.author: elizabethl
articles.description:
Announcing the WOC Australian team for 2024 in Edinburgh.

articles.author: elizabethl
articles.description:
The OA MTBO Selection Team has selected Maya Bennette and Will Whittington for the 2024 Australian MTBO team.
National MTBO Team Representatives Announced first appeared on Orienteering Australia.
articles.title: National MTBO Team Representatives Announced

articles.author: elizabethl
articles.description:
A reminder to enter for the 2024 NOL presentation dinner on Saturday 18 May in Canberra. Entries close 12 May.
2024 NOL Presentation Dinner Registration first appeared on Orienteering Australia.
articles.title: 2024 NOL Presentation Dinner Registration

articles.author: elizabethl
articles.description:
OA is reopening nominations to represent Australia in rounds 3 and 4 of the World Cup. Nominations close 19 May at 11:59pm.
Orienteering World Cup Nominations Reopen: Round 3 & 4 first appeared on Orienteering Australia.
articles.title: Orienteering World Cup Nominations Reopen: Round 3 & 4
